thread.title: Leeds appoints Evans as new coach after Uwe Rosler exit
thread.title_full: Leeds appoints Evans as new coach after Uwe Rosler exit | Boston Herald

author: Associated Press
title: Leeds appoints Evans as new coach after Uwe Rosler exit
text:
LEEDS, England â€” Leeds appointed Steve Evans as its new manager on Monday, just hours after the struggling Championship club parted company with his predecessor, Uwe Rosler.
Leeds issued a statement saying that Evans, who was coach of Rotherham until last month, had signed "a rolling contract until June 30 at Elland Road after taking training for the first time on Monday morning."
Saturday's 2-1 home defeat to Brighton was Leeds' third consecutive defeat. It left the Yorkshire club in 18th place in the 24-team second tier of English football, just three points above the relegation zone.
Evans, who left Rotherham after three years at the club, said: "The first thing we need to do is win some points and win some football matches."
